Improvements.Improvement: Replace Anonymous Inner Classes with Lambda Expressions
Improvements.Description: Java 8 introduced lambda expressions as a much more concise alternative to anonymous inner classes. Using lambda expressions can make your code more readable and maintainable.
The strings 'ENUM_ORDINAL' and 'TIME' are used multiple times in the code. It is a good practice to define them as constants. This would make it easier to maintain the code.

Improvements.Improvement: Avoid direct use of magic strings
Improvements.Description: Direct use of magic strings like 'UTC' can make the code harder to maintain. It would be better to define it as a constant.
